column4: I have a 500 GB Western Digital External Hard Drive connected to a VMware Server Virtual Machine (I have checked in vmware removable devices and it says its mounted) On a Ubuntu host. When i do sudo fdisk -l on the Server Virtual Machine it doesn't show up. Help anyone?
Ur as clear as mud, is it the Vmachine or the real machine that can't see the drive
The Virtual Machine
you have to configure it in the vmware console before the vmachine will see it
I already have. The Virtual Machine sees USB printers connected to it but not the external hard drive
I'll just check my wmware stuff now
When the VM starts up i get these errors: usb 1-1: device descriptor read/64, error -84
Ok I just added a USB controller to my Ubuntu Vmachine
Booting it now
AMD Quadcore 9750 with 4 gig RAM on Ubuntu 8.04 64bit : VMware running OX-Xchange; Windoze XP pro and Ubuntu 8.04 32 bit desktop
O-Xchange
Open Xchange groupware server
runs on to of Ubuntu 7
\on top
U there ?
Yes
Ok start your vmachine then in the VM menu on your vmware console choose removeable devices then USB devices then your usb drive
Just installing VMware tools to see if that fixed the problem -- i have already selected the drive in the vmware menu
For some reason my USB drive does not show up in the vmware removable devices menu hmmm
Even tho the actual Ubuntu box finds it
I'm an Ubuntu fan except for the STUPID names so I'm running Ubuntu 8.04 not HH
Sorry can't help you more until I get VMWare recognising my USB drive. L8R
